Class Entity

java.lang.Object
ijae.xgalead00.entity.Entity
Direct Known Subclasses:
Ghost, Player
public abstract class Entity extends Object
Abstract class representing any entity on the board, such as a player or ghost. Handles position, movement, animation cycling, and optional sprite rotation.

  • Constructor Details

    • Entity

      public Entity(int initx, int inity, javafx.scene.image.Image[] BaseImages)
      Creates an entity at the given coordinates with base images. Generates rotated images for all directions.
      Parameters:
      initx - initial x-coordinate
      inity - initial y-coordinate
      BaseImages - base images facing right

  • Method Details

    • RotateImage

      protected javafx.scene.image.Image RotateImage(javafx.scene.image.Image image, double angle)
      Rotates an image by the specified angle.
      Parameters:
      image - image to rotate
      angle - rotation angle in degrees
      Returns:
      rotated image

    • UpdateAnimation

      public void UpdateAnimation()
      Advances the animation frame according to AnimationSpeed.

    • draw

      public void draw(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc, int TileWidth, int TileHeight)
      Draws the entity on the board at its current position.
      Parameters:
      gc - graphics context
      TileWidth - width of a board tile
      TileHeight - height of a board tile

    • getCurrentImage

      protected javafx.scene.image.Image getCurrentImage()
      Returns the current image based on the direction and rotation setting.
      Returns:
      current image to draw

    • move

      public void move()
      Moves the entity one tile in its current direction without checking collisions.

    • move

      public void move(Tiles[][] tiles)
      Moves the entity one tile in its current direction, only if the target tile is accessible.
      Parameters:
      tiles - 2D array of board tiles

    • setDirection

      public void setDirection(Direction dir)
      Sets the entity's movement direction.

    • getDirection

      public Direction getDirection()
      Returns the entity's current direction.

    • getX

      public int getX()
      Returns the entity's X-coordinate.

    • getY

      public int getY()
      Returns the entity's Y-coordinate.
